lines.content: _Bob_ is a **Command Line Application** that helps users **manage and track tasks** easily and conveniently!
_Bob_ will be your best buddy to give you your much needed sanity check when needed.
3. Copy `Bob.jar` into an empty folder of your choice.
4. Open a command window in that folder. [_Not sure how to do this?_](https://www.groovypost.com/howto/open-command-window-terminal-window-specific-folder-windows-mac-linux/)
5. In the same window, run the command `java -jar Bob.jar`.
All ready to go! Bob is at your command!
#### ℹ️ Important things to take note:
Adds a Todo task to the list. Todo tasks do not take in any date and time.
Bob has added this task to your list:
Now you have 1 task in the list. You can do it!!
Adds a Deadline task to the list. Deadline tasks takes in date that the task needs to be completed by.
Bob has added this task to your list:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list. You can do it!!
Adds an Event task to the list. Event tasks takes in date that the task will occur.
Bob has added this task to your list:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list. You can do it!!
Marks the task of the given task number. Acts as a checklist to indicate that the task has been completed.
Good job! Bob has marked this task as done:
Unmarks the task of the given task number. Acts as a checklist to indicate that the task has not been completed.
Oh no... Bob has mark this task as UNdone:
Lists all the tasks in Bob's list.
`[T]` indicates the type of the task and `[X]` indicates that the task has been marked.
Here are the list of tasks that you have:
Deletes the task of the given task number.
Noted. Bob has removed this task:
Shows a list of tasks with descriptions that match the given search input.
:bulb: The search term can consist of a single word, or multiple words, and is **case-sensitive**.
Add Deadline task | `deadline TASK_DESCRIPTION /by DATE` | `deadline CS2113 /by 30/09/2022`
Add Event task | `event TASK_DESCRIPTION /at DATE` |  `event RC4 Open House /at 11/11/2021`
* Main class of the Bob bot.
* Initialises program, starts user interaction, and user can update taskList or data file.
private static TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
* Runs the program by loading the tasks from data file to taskList,
* Bob greets the user, and user interacts with Bob until bye command.
public static void run() throws IOException {
System.out.println("Please write your commands to Bob again.");
public static void main(String[] args) throws InvalidCommandFormatException, TaskListEmptyException, TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException, IOException, TaskNumberNotNumberException {
* Represents all types of commands that involves the addition of task
public abstract class AddCommand extends Command {
* When executed, it adds a deadline task to taskList
* When executed, it adds a event task to taskList
* When executed, it adds a todo task to taskList
* When executed, it prints a goodbye message and exits the program
private final String BYE_MESSAGE = "Bob says goodbye :<";
* When executed, it deletes the specified task from taskList
* When executed, it prints the list of tasks with description that match the keyword
* When executed, it prints an invalid command text
* When executed, it lists all tasks in the taskList
* When executed, it marks the specified task as done
* When executed, it unmarks the specified task
* Represents an error when user inputs an invalid command.
private static final String ERROR_MESSAGE = "Invalid Command Format! ";
* Represents an error when the task list is empty and the user tries to access it.
private static final String ERROR_MESSAGE = "Task List is empty!";
* Represents an error when user inputs an invalid type for task number.
* Task number should be an integer type
private static final String ERROR_MESSAGE = "Task Number should be an integer!";
* Represents an error when the task number that user inputs is not within the taskList.
private static final String ERROR_MESSAGE = "Task Number specified is not in the list!";
* Parses user input to execute the appropriate commands,
* and throws error when the command is invalid.
* Returns the correct command to be executed depending on user's input command
* @param taskList carries out user's command and stores user's tasks in a list
public static Command parseCommand(String input, TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
* Handles the storage of task list into the data file and
* the read/write operations between data file and taskList.
* Creates the data file if it does not exist.
* Loads the tasks from the data file to taskList
* @param taskList taskList that contains tasks stored in data file
System.out.println("File not found :< Bob is creating your data file now...");
* Loads the tasks from the taskList to data file
* @param taskList taskList that contains tasks to be loaded into data file
* Updates the task that is already in the data file
* @param commandType the command on how the task is to updated in the data file
public static void updateTaskInDataFile(TaskList taskList, String commandType) {
* Stores user's tasks in a list and
* contains methods that can be executed on the list based on user's command.
public static ArrayList<Task> tasksList = new ArrayList<>();
* Returns the number of tasks in the list
* Returns the task number of the task that user is looking at for that specific command
* Adds user's specified task to the list
* @param task the task that user specified to be added to the list
* Adds user's specified todo task to the list
* @param toDoInput user's input to add todo task (todo (task))
* @throws InvalidCommandFormatException if the command is invalid
* Adds user's specified deadline task to the list
* @param deadlineInput user's input to add deadline task (deadline (task) /by (time))
* Adds user's specified event task to the list
* @param eventInput user's input to add event task (event (task) /at (time))
* Checks whether the task has been marked or unmarked previously
* and prints the message accordingly to user's new input.
* @param newMark boolean value of whether the user wants to mark or unmark the task
* @throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException if the task number specified is not in the list
public void checkMarkTask(boolean newMark) throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException, TaskNumberNotNumberException {
* Marks the specified task of given task number that user inputs
* @param taskInput user's input to mark the specified task (mark (task number))
* @throws InvalidCommandFormatException if the command format is invalid
* @throws TaskListEmptyException if the task list is empty, and hence no task to mark
* @throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException if the task number specified is not in the list
* Unmarks the specified task of given task number that user inputs
* @param taskInput user's input to unmark the specified task (unmark (task number))
* @throws InvalidCommandFormatException if the command format is invalid
* @throws TaskListEmptyException if the task list is empty, and hence no task to mark
* @throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException if the task number specified is not in the list
* Deletes the specified task of given task number that user inputs
* @param deleteInput user's input to delete the specified task (delete (task number))
* @throws InvalidCommandFormatException if the command format is invalid
* @throws TaskListEmptyException if the task list is empty, and hence no task to mark
* @throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException if the task number specified is not in the list
* Finds tasks with relevant keyword that user inputs
* @param findInput user's keyword input to find tasks (find (keyword))
* @throws InvalidCommandFormatException if the command format is invalid
* @throws TaskListEmptyException if the task list is empty, and hence no task to mark
* @throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException if the task number specified is not in the list
* Loads task from task list to data file
* @param taskNumber task number of the task to be loaded to data file
* Sets the done status of the task
* @param taskNumber task number of the task to be set
* @param setDone boolean value of whether the task is to be set to done or not done
public void setTaskDoneStatus(int taskNumber, boolean setDone) {
* This class is used for tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time.
* Example of a deadline task: submit iP by 23/12/2001 2359
public Deadline(String description, char taskType, String deadline) {
* Returns a string of the task's type, status on mark done, description and deadline
* @return Formatted string for displaying in the Ui
* Returns a string of the task's type, status on mark done and description,
* where 1 represents the task is marked done, and 0 means not done
* @return Formatted string for writing in the data file
* This class is used for tasks that need to be done at a specific date/time.
* Example of a event task: attend career talk at 23/12/2001 2359
public Event(String description, char taskType, String startTime) {
* Returns a string of the task's type, status on mark done, description and event date/time
* @return Formatted string for displaying in the Ui
* Returns a string of the task's type, status on mark done and description,
* where 1 represents the task is marked done, and 0 means not done
* @return Formatted string for writing in the data file
* This class is used to create tasks.
* Each Task must contain a description, whether marked done or not, and the tasktype.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a string of the task's type, status on mark done and description
* @return Formatted string for displaying in the Ui
* Returns a string of the task's type, status on mark done and description,
* where 1 represents the task is marked done, and 0 means not done
* @return Formatted string for writing in the data file
* This class is used for tasks that need to be done.
* Example of a event task: finish CS2113 iP
* Handles the interactions with the user,
* including all the text UI to be displayed to the use
System.out.println("I'm here to give you the sanity check of the list of things that you need to keep track :>");
* Reads in input from the user
* Prints text when new task has been added to the list
System.out.println("Bob has added this task to your list:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + TaskList.getTasksListSize() + " tasks in the list. You can do it!!");
* Prints a list of all the tasks in the task list
System.out.println("Here are the list of tasks that you have:");
* Prints text when task has been newly mark or unmark
* @param newMark whether the task is newly mark or unmark
public static void printMarkTaskText(boolean newMark) throws TaskNumberOutOfBoundsException {
System.out.println("Bob has already marked this task!");
System.out.println("Oh no... Bob has mark this task as UNdone:");
System.out.println("Bob has already unmarked this task!");
System.out.println("Good job! Bob has marked this task as done:");
* Prints text when a task is deleted from the task list
* @param task the task to be deleted
System.out.println("Noted. Bob has removed this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + TaskList.getTasksListSize() + " tasks in the list. All the best!");
* Prints the correct format text according to the wrongly input command
System.out.println("The command should be 'event (task name) /at (event date)'.");
* Prints the updated mark and description of a task
System.out.println("Task Number should be an integer!");
* Prints a list of tasks with the keyword from the task list
* @param keyword user's input keyword to find
System.out.println("Bob cannot find any related task in your list.");
* Prints text when the data file has been created
* or when the file already exists, along with the file path
* @param isNewlyCreated whether the file is newly created
* @param file_path file path of data file
public static void printFilePath(boolean isNewlyCreated, String file_path) {
System.out.printf("Bob has created the file at %s\n", file_path);
* Prints text when there is an error in creating the file
* @param file_path the file path in which there is an error
System.out.printf("Error creating file: Could not create file at %s\n", file_path);
System.out.println("Error reading data from file: Invalid format");
System.out.println("Error has occurred when loading the task to data file.");
System.out.println("Error occurred when updating the task in data file.");
System.out.println("Bob bids goodbye. Hope to see you again soon! :>");
